title: Expose Weaknesses Doesn't Belong in Ferocity
body: The only champs who would take this would be tanks and supports yet we primarily run 0-12-18. It should be added into the resolve tree.

replies.body: Why would you even implement a support mastery and put it into the tree mainly for adcs or some mages in the first place lol

> [{quoted}](name=Penns,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=zeluKjOE,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2016-02-27T08:33:55.538+0000)
>
> Why would you even implement a support mastery and put it into the tree mainly for adcs or some mages in the first place lol

Same reason they changed the health mastery from % to 45 flat, because some of the early tier masteries exist to try and draw outside roles to off spec in the tree.

That's why OP is wrong. It doesn't "belong" anywhere. It was created to draw supports to pick Ferocity, likely so that some squishy FQC supports would be easier to kill without their 12 points in Resolve, thus lowering their win rates overall if Expose Weakness is attractive enough to convince many people to switch.

Well there are the Utility Carries {{champion:22}} {{champion:15}} {{champion:110}} and technically {{champion:203}}. Mages I'd imagine could also take advantage of their giant AOE chipping everybody with Exposed Weakness.

Now gues why tanks and sup till now always went 0-18-12 or 0-12-18?
because furor had rather bad options for them.
However, i can totally see why a karma or lulu might get 12-18-0 now with exposed weaknesse.
Of they now add a more suitable masterie on the oppresor/headhunter tier aswell, many sups might opt for 12/x/x, and if they ever decide that deathfire gets some levelscaleing basedamage like thunderlords, i can even see some sups with 18/x/x

If they really want deversity in masteries, putting expose weaknesses onto the furor tree is the right decision.
Though a better idea would be to remove the tree system all together and give each player X-points to spent per tier level(currently it's 10 for tier 1 and 3, 5 for tier 5, 2 for tier 2 and 4, and 1 point for keystones)
This would actually alow to customize masteries. Want flatpen and the dot masterie? No problem. Want to go tank but have an aditional 5% cdr? Here we go!
THe current limitations through the different trees just don't allow for much diversity, the keystone mostly dictates all other chpoices, and the keystone is often set in stone by the champ pick...

That's entirely the point.  It's to encourage supports to put 6 or 12 in ferocity instead of just going 12 resolve everygame.  It's a tradeoff.  If they just put  it in resolve it would be taken everytime, but the carries that put points in ferocity might go for double-edged sword of feast instead.
Precisely, Expose Weaknesses made me to even consider the ferocoty for the first time instead of gong 0/18/12 or 0/12/18.
And junglers.
I actually feel it and "assassin" should be swapped...
Expose weakness is a buff to your kill potential. So it belongs in the tree devoted to upping your kill potential.
It's to your allies kill potential actually.
Or even the utility tree. Swap it with the Assassin mastery.
This is what I would like more when I think about it, personally I'd like it in resolve because i play mostly tanks but it would fit better in cunning.

It's not for just your everyday support or tank, as that would be kinda stupid how easy it would be for them to use. It's for the ones that are specing into the Ferocity tree already, kill lane supports, juggernauts, etc.
Yes, that makes sense. Let's have a mastery for increasing damage inside the defensive tree. Genius!

FROM 20 AA's.. and you can say it's good for junglers but I would think explorer is a better option going camp to camp and ganking since the jungle is very sustainable now.

You know the ferocity mastery that allows you to do more damage to CCed enemies?

I think tanks can run 12/0/18 fine. I use that for most of my tanks. And I main tanks.

It fits worse in Resolve and the Cunning tree would be way too overloaded with supportive options.

There's no supportive options in Ferocity, and Expose Weakness fits perfectly in the Ferocity tree as an aggressive supportive option.
Expose Weaknesses has been create for ADC
indirectly one could say so, as they most likely profit the most from it despite rarly taking it them self...
I've been testing Expose Weakness on Garen. Works great for teamfights.
